message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.CV

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it presents a novel method for subgoal discovery and skill learning in hierarchical reinforcement learning that is based on unsupervised learning. The paper also discusses the use of intrinsic motivation as a learning mechanism, which is a common topic in machine learning. 

The paper also touches on topics related to artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and robotics (cs.RO) as it discusses the challenges of scaling up reinforcement learning to large state spaces and sparse delayed reward feedback, which are common issues in these fields. 

The paper also presents results on two RL problems with visual inputs, which suggests that it may be relevant to the sub-category of computer vision (cs.CV). 

Finally, the paper discusses the use of subgoals and skills in hierarchical reinforcement learning, which is a topic that is relevant to the sub-category of control systems (cs.SY).
